Message.Title: a Zimmerman, Joe the Plumber ticket for the gop?
Message.Msg: In 2008, Wurzelbacher signed with a publicity management agent regarding media relationships, including "a possible record deal with a major label, personal appearances and corporate sponsorships."[36] In November 2008, Wurzelbacher was hired for a series of commercials reminding people to convert analog television to digital.[37] Wurzelbacher was hired to help consumers understand the DTV transition in the United States through a series of videos designed to explain the changeover.[38] In November 2008, Wurzelbacher began promoting his book Joe the Plumber: Fighting for the American Dream.[39][40] Co-written with novelist Thomas Tabback and published by PearlGate Publishing[41] of Austin, Texas,[42] the book addresses Wurzelbacher’s ideas concerning American values.[43] In particular, Wurzelbacher criticizes John McCain and states that he did not want him as the Republican presidential nominee.[44] According to the Toledo Blade, Wurzelbacher criticized McCain as a candidate, saying that the election was "the lesser of two evils."[45] On December 10, 2008, it was reported that Wurzelbacher also criticized McCain for voting for the $700 billion Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008, also known as the bank bailout.[46] On the issue of taxation, he does not consider himself to be a supporter of either party.[47] In May 2009, Time magazine reported that Wurzelbacher was quitting the Republican Party.[50] On February 13, 2010, Wurzelbacher attended a political event for Pennsylvania gubernatorial candidate Sam Rohrer. Speaking to a reporter afterwards, Wurzelbacher said that "McCain was trying to use [him]", and accused McCain of having "really screwed [his] life up".[52][53] In Wisconsin, on February 2011, he spoke at a counter-demonstration during protests against Governor Scott Walker's attempts to abolish collective bargaining rights of some public employees.[54] Later in 2011 He lost his bid for a seat in the United States House of Representatives, hi

Message.Title: Black Woman Fires Warning Shot, gets 20 Yrs
Message.Msg: White man kills black child, is set free. This is justice in the deep south. TAMPA, Fla. -- Marissa Alexander had never been arrested before she fired a bullet at a wall one day in 2010 to scare off her husband when she felt he was threatening her. Nobody got hurt, but this month a northeast Florida judge was bound by state law to sentence her to 20 years in prison. Alexander, a 31-year-old mother of a toddler and 11-year-old twins, knew it was coming. She had claimed self-defense, tried to invoke Florida's "stand your ground" law and rejected plea deals that could have gotten her a much shorter sentence. A jury found her guilty as charged: aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. Because she fired a gun while committing a felony, Florida's mandatory-minimum gun law dictated the 20-year sentence.

Message.Title: The Best "Free Advice" On ETFC You Can Get:
Message.Msg: I'm a professional trader. The best advice for ETFC is to buy and do not look back. In 5-10 years you'll more than likely be up well over 1000-5000%. So, in other words, $1000 invested today will more than likely become $9000-$49,000 dollars in 5-10 years. You could lose the entire $1000. This is what investing in equities is all about. High risk can equal high reward. Anytime you buy equity in a company (the stock), you take a very big risk. What is even more risky is to not invest at all. Then there is a 100% chance that your money will lose diminish in value if you do not invest at all. Tip: Do not even look at your stocks everyday. One time per month is sufficient for the majority of investors, or at the very most one time per week.

Message.Title: Trayvon Martin made mistakes too, mistakes that ultimately cost him his life!
Message.Msg: You don't punch someone in the nose... EVER! This action can get you killed (and this time it certainly did). If the neighborhood watch guy asks you questions you DO NOT punch him in the nose. Trayvon Martin was wrong to be aggressive towards Zimmerman. Zimmerman was completely wrong in what he did too. Zimmerman now has to live with himself, for the rest of his life, for murdering some innocent black young person even though the court did rule in his favor. The parents of Trayvon should have taught him about the "A soft answer turneth away wrath" principle! This is the lesson to be learned by others, in the future, who are approached by someone crazy like George Zimmerman. I'm black and I know not to be aggressive when people who think they are in authority question me. Being agressive is simply NOT the answer people! Just walk away. "Keep on Truckin' " is what we'd say back in the 1970's! Why get shot by some idiot who has a gun? It might feel good at the moment but It's not worth your life!
